title: Witnesses in Derek Chauvin Trial Recount Toll of George Floyd's Final Minutes
summary: Defense says there were actions that witnesses to the final minutes of the incident couldn't see. MINNEAPOLIS-Witnesses struggled to maintain composure Tuesday as they described watching and in some cases taking video of the encounter between George Floyd and Derek Chauvin in an emotional second day of testimony in the murder trial of the former police officer.

title: No, Volkswagen Isn't Rebranding Itself Voltswagen
summary: German car maker says announcement by its U.S. operation was supposed to be an April Fools' gag. BERLIN-Volkswagen is staying Volkswagen.

title: Deutsche Bank Reorganizes Risk and Compliance Functions
summary: The move comes as chief risk officer Stuart Lewis prepares to leave the bank. Deutsche Bank AG is restructuring its compliance function as its longtime chief risk officer prepares to depart after 25 years at the German lender.

title: Brother of Honduras President Sentenced to Life in Drug-Trafficking Case
summary: Trial evidence showed that Juan Antonio 'Tony' Hernández had smuggled some 185 tons of cocaine to the U.S.. The brother of Honduran President Juan Orlando Hernández was sentenced to life in prison Tuesday after he was convicted on drug-trafficking charges in a trial that underscored allegations the president has helped turn Honduras into a violent narco-state.

title: NYPD Investigates Attack on Asian Woman as Possible Hate Crime
summary: State, local police are searching for man who kicked woman to ground as she walked to church, breaking her pelvis. An attack on an Asian-American woman in Midtown Manhattan is being investigated by state and local law enforcement as a possible hate crime, officials said Tuesday.

title: U.S. Restores Reproductive Rights Report in Global Survey
summary: State Department's annual human-rights report also provided a detailed accounting of abuses committed in China. WASHINGTON-The Biden administration is resuming the practice of evaluating women's reproductive rights in various countries as part of the State Department's annual survey of global human rights, reversing a decision by the Trump administration.

title: Auto-Chip Maker Needs Up to Four Months to Recover From Fire
summary: Renesas reports more damage to equipment at key factory in semiconductor supply chain. TOKYO-Japanese auto-chip maker Renesas Electronics Corp. said Tuesday it has found more damage from a recent factory fire and predicted it would take three to four months to recover full production.

title: Asian-Americans: A Social-Justice Blind Spot?
summary: Students discuss what progressive activists see and don't see.. Editor's note: This week's Future View discusses the relationship between Asian-Americans and movements for social justice. Next week we'll ask, "Should businesses require employees or customers to show 'vaccine passports' to enter their premises? Should government insist on it?" Students can click here to submit opinions of fewer than 250 words before April 6. The best responses will be published that night.

title: Biden Underscores Diversity With First Judicial Nominees
summary: President nominates several Black women and a man who would become the first Muslim-American U.S. judge. WASHINGTON-President Biden announced his first batch of judicial nominees Tuesday, using his early choices to place an emphasis on bringing more racial and professional diversity to the federal courts.

title: The Equality Act Is at War With Reality
summary: Every child knows the difference between mom and dad. Congress seeks to outlaw the distinction.. At stake in the so-called Equality Act, currently before the Senate, is neither women's sports nor bathrooms, at least not ultimately. At stake is the freedom of rational human beings to use a common vocabulary when speaking about what all can see. Also at stake are the countless vulnerable souls falling prey to the tyrannizing "gender identity" ideology and the medical atrocities that go with it. That is why religious freedom is also at stake. Religion is the last bastion of sanity.

title: The Science Behind 'Long Covid' and the Desire to Wish It Away
summary: We've been burned before by attributing unexplained physical symptoms to psychological issues.. Why do the medically unexplained symptoms of "Covid long-haulers" get dismissed as psychological in origin? Take it from someone who has personally experienced it, researched it and treated patients who have it: Long Covid is a force to be reckoned with.

title: LinkedIn Adds 'Creator Mode' to Help More of Its Users Turn Influencers
summary: The new setting will allow users to post hashtags high on their profile of the subjects they most frequently write about-likely encouraging others to follow them based on their interests. LinkedIn, the professional networking site, is inviting users to what it is calling "creator mode," a setting designed to encourage users to post more of their own original content, perhaps with an eye to becoming influencers, or in corporate-speak, thought leaders.

title: Snowbirds Fly South for the Vaccine
summary: Canada's ineptitude prompts a migration of seniors to Florida.. Toronto

title: Spotify Acquires Sports-Talk App Locker Room
summary: Deal values the company at around $50 million. Spotify Technology SA is making its move into live audio by acquiring the sports-talk app Locker Room and its maker Betty Labs.

title: 'The Light of Days' Review: To Resist and Connect
summary: The young women of the Polish ghetto were a deﬁant and resourceful breed, acting as couriers, smugglers and, sometimes, warriors.. They were nicknamed the "ghetto girls" but the label does not do justice to the defiant, mostly forgotten Eastern European Jewish women in their teens and 20s who, acting in resistance to the Nazis, undertook one mission impossible after another to disrupt the machinery of the Holocaust and save as many Jews as they could.

title: Like 2016, 2020 Isn't Going Away
summary: Our elections are racy, but meddling by intelligence officials shouldn't be tolerated.. "Trump didn't believe his election lies," went a headline at the respectable news and commentary site Slate.com.

title: Notable & Quotable: The Majoritarian Filibuster
summary: It 'serves as an underappreciated check.'. From "The Majoritarian Filibuster" by Benjamin Eidelson, Yale Law Journal, 2013:

title: The Wuhan Whitewash
summary: A WHO report on Covid's origin echoes Chinese propaganda.. The World Health Organization on Tuesday finally released its report on the origins of the coronavirus, and the result wasn't worth the wait. The document is best understood as a whitewash heavily influenced by the Chinese Communist Party and Westerners with conflicts of interest.

title: Schumer's New Filibuster Evasion Plan
summary: He says Democrats should get multiple 50-vote budget bills.. Don't look now, but Majority Leader Chuck Schumer has a plan to kill the Senate legislative filibuster by other means. Call it robo-reconciliation, and it's creative if also a procedural scam.

title: Brushback for Capitol Riot Prosecutors
summary: Judges bristle at their handling of media and pretrial detention.. The Justice Department wants to make a firm statement about the Jan. 6 Capitol riot, which was a national disgrace. But as the criminal cases make their way through the courts, there are signs of prosecutorial overreach.

title: City Restores Trash Pickup Service Cut During Pandemic Using Covid Relief Aid
summary: New York neighborhoods coped with overflowing litter baskets amid reductions to the sanitation department's budget. New York City will increase trash pickups after using federal Covid-19 relief money to restore funding cuts to the city's sanitation department, Mayor Bill de Blasio said Tuesday.

title: Pronouns and the Philosophy Professor
summary: A Christian teacher, a transgender student, and two years in court.. Can a Christian professor be disciplined or fired for refusing to call a transgender student by a preferred pronoun? We may find out. The professor's lawsuit was initially dismissed, but last week a federal appeals court reinstated the case, citing plausible violation of his First Amendment rights.

title: White House Briefs Lawmakers on $2 Trillion Infrastructure Plan
summary: Package is the first of a two-part program aimed at reshaping the country's economic policy and competing with China. WASHINGTON-The White House briefed lawmakers on a roughly $2 trillion infrastructure plan that also calls for raising taxes on companies, according to people familiar with the matter, ahead of President Biden's announcement of the proposal.

title: Chewy Turns Profit as Covid-19 Boosts Online Sales
summary: Pet-products retailer expects sales to top $2 billion again this quarter and reach nearly $9 billion for year. Chewy Inc. reported its first quarterly profit and more than $2 billion in sales in the latest period, helped by the Covid-19 pandemic's boost to online shopping and pet ownership.

title: Freight Companies Brace for Post-Suez Port Backups
summary: Some logistics operators are booking inland transport in advance for an expected flood of cargo at European gateways. Logistics operators are bracing for a cascade of sea containers that bring new congestion to supply chains as shipping networks work through backlogs from the Suez Canal blockage.

title: Lululemon Bolsters Revenue, Profit
summary: Comparable sales rose 21% in latest quarter, driven by demand for women's apparel. Lululemon Athletica Inc. posted further gains in sales and profit to close out its latest fiscal year, showcasing the apparel company's continued resilience during a time when surging coronavirus cases shifted more consumer spending online.

title: Brazil's Military Chiefs Quit as Pandemic Pressures Government
summary: High-level resignations follow months of tensions over Bolsonaro's efforts to garner political support from armed forces. SÃO PAULO-The heads of Brazil's army, navy and air force resigned Tuesday, rocking a right-wing government that is already facing public fury over President Jair Bolsonaro's inability to contain the fast-spreading coronavirus pandemic.

title: S&P 500 Edges Down as Investors Sell Bonds, Tech Stocks
summary: Treasury yields rose for a fourth consecutive day, sapping demand for tech shares. Major U.S. stock indexes pulled back Tuesday as investors sold government bonds along with shares of technology companies that had powered higher in a low-yield environment.

title: JPMorgan, Salesforce Join Growing List of Firms Dumping Office Space
summary: Rise of remote work means demand for office space could be permanently lower for some companies. JPMorgan Chase & Co., Salesforce . com Inc. and PricewaterhouseCoopers are among the major firms looking to unload big blocks of office space, the latest sign that remote work is hurting demand for this pillar of commercial real estate.

title: Supreme Court Looks at Consequences of Falsely Calling Someone a Terrorist
summary: Case involves class-action lawsuit against credit reporting agency TransUnion, which erroneously listed 8,000 consumers as being potential terrorists. WASHINGTON-A class-action lawsuit by some 8,000 consumers falsely labeled as potential terrorists on their credit reports appeared likely to survive following Supreme Court arguments Tuesday but several justices suggested not all of the individuals merited compensation.

title: U.S. Calls for Independent Study of Virus Origin
summary: Statement, backed by Australia, Japan, the U.K. and other governments, said a WHO-led mission to China wasn't afforded full access to pertinent data. The U.S. and more than a dozen other countries expressed concern about a World Health Organization-led mission to China to explore the origins of Covid-19, saying it came too late and wasn't afforded full or timely access to pertinent data.

title: Cable-News Viewership Falls After Trump's Exit
summary: Fox News, CNN and MSNBC each claim No. 1 spot in different ratings categories. U.S. cable-news viewership fell for all major networks in the first three months of the year, as the country moved past the presidential election and its chaotic aftermath.

title: Boston Dynamics Debuts Robot Aimed at Rising Warehouse Automation
summary: 'Stretch' uses a machine-learning algorithm to recognize boxes of different sizes, textures and colors. Boston Dynamics, a robotics company known for its four-legged robot "dog," this week announced a new product, a computer-vision enabled mobile warehouse robot named "Stretch."

title: 'ABT Live From City Center: A Ratmansky Celebration' Review: Reaching for Joy
summary: In a program of works by the American Ballet Theatre's esteemed artist in residence, an ebullient world premiere created in a 'ballet bubble' rose to the top..

title: 'Made for Love' Review: High-Tech Romance Gone Wrong
summary: Cristin Milioti plays a woman trying to escape from her narcissistic billionaire husband, but he's surreptitiously tracking her every move through a microchip.. 'The name Gogol has become synonymous with technology around the world," we are informed during the irresistible "Made for Love," and no, that's not a typo: Byron Gogol (Billy Magnussen) is a tech billionaire, a futurist, a creepy mash-up of certain prominent social-media figures and a soulless nerdy tyrant. His peculiarities prompt a journalist to ask, "Is Byron Gogol a genius savant living in an optimized world of his own creation? Or is he a megalomaniac narcissist who cannot function in normal society?" His wife would pick No. 2. Thankfully, it's her show.

title: Covid-19 Vaccination Cards Are the Only Proof of Shots, Soon an Essential
summary: The U.S. lacks a central database for immunizations due to privacy concerns, leaving nonstandardized impermanent cards as the sole record of shots. Millions of adults vaccinated against Covid-19 have little to prove it beyond a paper card they received at inoculation sites.

title: Germany Restricts Use of AstraZeneca Vaccine for Under-60s
summary: Move follows 31 brain blood-clotting incidents and nine deaths in Germany after vaccination. BERLIN-Germany's government said Tuesday it will restrict the use of AstraZeneca PLC's Covid-19 vaccine for people younger than 60 following fresh blood-clotting incidents among recipients, potentially presenting the country's sputtering vaccine rollout with fresh delays.

title: Treasury Yields Whipsaw Ahead of Biden Spending Announcement
summary: Bond yields marked new territory on Tuesday before quickly retreating. Yields on U.S. government bonds marked new territory in their recent climb on Tuesday before quickly retreating, as investors focused on President Biden's next big spending push and prepared for the end of the quarter.

title: New York Gets Federal Approval to Proceed on Congestion-Pricing Plan
summary: The state can now conduct required environmental assessment for proposal to fund public-transportation upgrades. The Federal Highway Administration cleared the way for New York to set up congestion pricing in Manhattan by greenlighting a required environmental assessment.

title: Top Companies for Social Responsibility
summary: Microsoft heads this list from the Management Top 250 ranking. Microsoft Corp. scored highest for social responsibility in the latest Management Top 250 ranking, followed by HP Inc . , Intel Corp . and Cisco Systems Inc . , in that order. All four companies also are among the top 10 companies overall in the ranking, with Microsoft No. 1.

title: A Good Battery Is the Best Defense Against a Military Assault
summary: If China maintains control over the supply chain, it will be able to deny power to advanced U.S. weapons.. The massive push toward electric vehicles presents risks and opportunities for America's military. As adversaries make it harder for U.S. forces to reach and operate across long distances, the energy provided by advanced batteries can help the Pentagon achieve its multiple missions. This requires a secure innovation and production base for advanced battery technology, something the U.S. doesn't have at the moment.

title: Lessons for Politicians at Passover
summary: Revolution is exhilarating. Building a system of liberty is slower and harder.. Every enduring ritual is experienced differently in each generation, or even in the course of a single life. When I was younger, I approached Passover in a simple celebratory spirit, as the movement from oppression to freedom. Now I understand the moment of liberation as the beginning of an arduous journey that could have ended poorly and-absent a series of divine interventions-surely would have. There are lessons for today's political revolutionaries.

title: Return of Motorists Poised to Boost Corn Prices
summary: Higher demand expected for gasoline additive ethanol could lift already lofty corn prices. Corn prices have hit their highest levels in almost eight years. Analysts say they are likely to get a further boost from motorists.

title: Nike Files Lawsuit Over Lil Nas X's Satan Shoes
summary: Sneaker giant says custom Nike Air Max shoes were produced without its approval and it has no relationship with rapper. Nike Inc. filed a trademark infringement lawsuit against a small marketing company that released a customized pair of its sneakers with satanic themes in collaboration with Lil Nas X to promote the rapper's new song.

title: No Contest (Wednesday Crossword, March 31)
A Million More Student-Loan Holders Gain Relief
summary: Education Department expands collections suspension to include defaulted loans backed by government but owned by private entities. The Biden administration is suspending collections on defaulted student loans held by more than one million borrowers, the latest in a flurry of moves to offer relief to adults struggling to make ends meet during the pandemic.

title: Wells Fargo Plans to Bring Employees Back to the Office in September
summary: The bank said in a memo, 'We believe most of us benefit by being physically together'. Wells Fargo & Co. plans to start bringing employees back to the office after Labor Day, citing the increasing availability of vaccines.

title: New York Fed's John Williams Upbeat About Economic Outlook
summary: Low interest rates will help the recovery, Federal Reserve Bank of New York's leader says. Federal Reserve Bank of New York leader John Williams said Tuesday he is upbeat about the economic outlook, adding that low central bank interest rates will help the economy recover from the coronavirus pandemic.

title: The Neighborhood Bonds That Will Outlast the Pandemic
summary: People grew closer to their neighbors in the past year-and relied on them during crises. As we begin to emerge from the Covid-19 pandemic, neighbors say they'll carry those new friendships forward.. It took a pandemic for the Gurocks and the Catanias of Anderson Avenue to finally meet.

title: Coinbase Hires Ex-SEC Director to Run Capital Markets Division
summary: Cryptocurrency company's appointment of Brett Redfearn marks key hire as it prepares to go public. Coinbase Global Inc. hired a former high-ranking director from the Securities and Exchange Commission to run its capital-markets division as the cryptocurrency company prepares to go public.

title: Summer Zervos Lawsuit Against Donald Trump Can Move Forward
summary: New York's highest court dismissed the former president's challenge to the 'Apprentice' contestant's defamation claims. New York state's highest court on Tuesday cleared the way for a former "Apprentice" contestant's defamation lawsuit against Donald Trump to move forward, allowing her lawyers to eventually question the former president under oath.

title: Pfizer to Test Covid-19 Vaccine That Doesn't Need Ultracold Storage
summary: Freeze-dried version would make handling the shots easier in rural areas and low-income countries. Pfizer Inc. and partner BioNTech SE plan to begin soon testing a freeze-dried version of its Covid-19 vaccine, which if proven to work safely could ease storage and handling of the shots in rural U.S. areas and low-income countries.

title: The NFL Expands Its Regular Season to 17 Games
summary: The long-awaited move comes after blockbuster new media deals and provides more action from America's most popular sports league. The league's owners voted Tuesday to expand the regular season to 17 games. It's the first schedule expansion since 1978, when the league moved to 16 games and stayed that way for decades. The decision, which also results in one fewer preseason games, was widely expected on the heels of a series of agreements that paved the way for more action starting in the 2021 season.

title: Responding to Gramm and Early on Inequality
summary: It might prove instructive to see how age affects the results by income quintile and overall.. Phil Gramm and John Early usefully adjust the Census Bureau's estimates of household income for taxes and transfers ("Incredible Shrinking Income Inequality," op-ed, March 24). This is a much-needed step, and the authors find correctly that income inequality was slightly lower in 2017 than in 1967 (contrary to the result without their adjustment).

title: Readers Sound Off on Pretentious Pet Peeves
summary: It was fun to read a critique of overstuffed language.. Dear Joseph Epstein: Thanks for the humor ("50-Cent Words Are No Bargain," op-ed, March 25). It was fun to read a critique of overstuffed language.

title: Housing Demand, Tight Supply Propel U.S. Home Prices
summary: S&P CoreLogic Case-Shiller index increased 11.2% in year ended in January, highest rise since February 2006. U.S. home prices are rising at the fastest pace in 15 years, reflecting how fiercely buyers are competing for a limited supply of homes in nearly every corner of the country.

title: Social Security Recipients' Stimulus Payments Coming by Next Week, Treasury Says
summary: Bulk of stimulus payments to those who get benefits but don't file tax returns should arrive by April 7. WASHINGTON-The next big chunk of stimulus payments-for Social Security beneficiaries-should reach bank accounts by next week, the Treasury Department said on Tuesday.

title: Academy Sports & Outdoors Deserves Some Badges
summary: The retailer lags behind Dick's Sporting Goods on some metrics but looks cheap whichever way you spin it. Academy Sports & Outdoors has attracted very few fans in the stock market since listing in October. Investors only now seem to be noticing its potential.

title: What Is a Total Return Swap and How Did Archegos Capital Use It?
summary: The common Wall Street derivative has for years faced scrutiny from regulators and some well-known investors. Archegos Capital Management's investments were partly concentrated in a common Wall Street derivative, called a total return swap, that has for years faced scrutiny from regulators and even some well-known investors.

title: IMF Sees Brighter Outlook for Global Economy
summary: Covid-19 vaccine, U.S. fiscal stimulus expected to drive faster growth in 2021, 2022. WASHINGTON-The International Monetary Fund is preparing to raise its forecasts for the global economy in 2021 and 2022 thanks to recent fiscal stimulus in the U.S. and increasing vaccination against Covid-19, Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva said Tuesday.

title: Cameo Aims to Connect Celebrities With Fans and It's Now Valued at $1 Billion
summary: The four-year-old video platform features more than 40,000 personalities but faces increased competition, potentially from Facebook. The startup behind online service Cameo tripled its valuation to more than $1 billion after raising more capital, reflecting the hot market for platforms that help celebrities and content creators make money from their fan bases.

title: How to Learn Musical Instruments at Home-Without an Instructor
summary: A new breed of smart instruments turns the chore of mastering the basics into an interactive game. AS A CHILD in London, Olivia Campbell showed promise as a pianist, only to stop taking lessons before the equivalent of middle school. When the now-grown operations engineer decided to reacquaint herself with the piano late last year, she got a Lumi.

title: Archegos Gives Investors Warning Signs
summary: Question is whether Archegos is just an accident on a lonely road or a pileup waiting to happen. On the highway, the most dangerous moment is when everything is calm and the outlook is great, because that's when you put on the cruise control, turn up the music and miss the lumbering RV pulling out of a rest stop.

title: U.S. Pledges Nearly $600 Million in Aid to Syria
summary: Biden administration asks U.N. to keep cross-border route into country open to ease provision of aid. WASHINGTON-The U.S. on Tuesday said it would provide almost $600 million in humanitarian assistance to Syria aimed at helping the millions of refugees in neighboring countries as well as the Syrian population.

title: Landlords, Housing Groups Brace for Evictions in Tri-State Area
summary: Eviction moratorium extended and more federal aid is coming, but many worry it won't be enough. title: Supreme Court's NCAA Case Could Sweep Beyond Athletics
summary: Justices' consideration of athlete-compensation limits raises prospect of antitrust ramifications for labor markets, joint ventures. WASHINGTON-The Supreme Court's long-awaited case examining NCAA limits on compensating college athletes has clear implications for the sports world, but could also test U.S. antitrust law at a time of national debate about whether courts and lawmakers should do more to protect competition.

title: Families Clash Over Gathering for Easter and Passover
summary: As vaccinations rise-but so do Covid cases in many states-family decisions about getting together for spring holidays are yielding new tensions. The 25-year-old teacher in Washington, D.C., has gotten her first vaccine shot, but isn't yet comfortable flying to her mom's house in Arkansas or visiting with unvaccinated extended family.

title: Investors Mount Competing Bids to Buy Hertz Out of Bankruptcy
summary: Investors led by Centerbridge, Warburg Pincus and Dundon Capital are challenging a rival Hertz bankruptcy-exit proposal. Rival groups of investors are vying for the right to back the expected recovery of Hertz Global Holdings Inc.'s car-rental business and ease a path out of bankruptcy.

title: Banks Limit Losses With Fast Sale of Archegos Assets
summary: The decision to sell early helped insulate financial giants from losses that have hit others. Goldman Sachs Group Inc. and Morgan Stanley were quick to move large blocks of assets before other large banks that traded with Archegos Capital Management, as the scale of the hedge fund's losses became apparent, according to people with knowledge of the transactions. The strategy helped limit the U.S. firms' losses in last week's epic stock liquidation, they said.

title: Xiaomi Enters Electric Vehicle Market With $10 Billion Investment
summary: Chinese smartphone giant joins crowded but burgeoning automobile market. HONG KONG-Chinese electronics giant Xiaomi Corp. became the latest tech company drawn to China's burgeoning electric vehicle market, pledging $10 billion over the next decade to the initiative.

title: Behind Biden's Big Plans: Belief That Government Can Drive Growth
summary: Resume Subscription. WASHINGTON-President Biden envisions long-term federal spending claiming its biggest share of the American economy in decades. He wants to pay for that program in part by charging the highest-earning Americans the biggest tax rates they've faced in years.

title: U.S. Consumer Confidence at Highest Since Pandemic's Start
summary: Americans display more optimism about business and labor-market conditions in coming months. Consumer confidence in the U.S. rose in March to its highest level since the pandemic started a year ago, with Americans expressing more optimism about business and labor-market conditions in the coming months.

title: Shake Shack's Finance Chief to Depart
summary: Current CFO Tara Comonte is set to become CEO of a life-sciences company. Shake Shack Inc. said its finance chief, Tara Comonte, is leaving the burger chain to take the top post at another company.

title: Need Somewhere to Store Your Stuff? Try Your Neighbor's Place
summary: Some residents are renting space in their neighbor's closet or extra bedroom for a fraction of the price. We could all stow our winter clothes and futons along Fifth Avenue, freeing up much-needed closet space.

title: Moody's Fined for Ratings Linked to Berkshire Hathaway, Its Biggest Shareholder
summary: Europe's top markets regulator fined the credit-ratings firm $4 million for breaching conflict of interest rules. summary: 'The Equalizer' actress talks about her challenging early years in Trinidad, her years in Brooklyn with her mother and how she feels when she watches her daughter dance.. title: Japanese Builder of Suez Canal Ship Has Bigger Problem: Industry Decline
summary: Unlisted Imabari Shipbuilding reported a loss last year and tries building ever-bigger ships to survive. summary: More gadgets are being designed for the bedroom. Experts say they won't necessarily help you get more restful sleep, though some detect signs of sleep apnea.. I've been sleeping with my gadgets-five of them.

summary: Lawmakers, Biden administration consider measures to expand health coverage, but tight margins in Congress leave little room for dissent. WASHINGTON-Congressional Democrats and the Biden administration are planning another round of healthcare initiatives that could include lowering the Medicare eligibility age, following their major expansion of the Affordable Care Act this year.

title: Archegos Blowout Heaps Pressure on Credit Suisse
summary: Shares in the Swiss bank fell again Tuesday, while Japanese bank MUFG warned of a $300 million loss. It wasn't enough to prevent two big blowouts: at Archegos Capital Management and Greensill Capital.

title: China's Big Banks Eked Out Higher Profits in Turbulent 2020
summary: The turnaround in their fortunes during the year mirrored China's rapid economic rebound from the coronavirus pandemic. title: Why Men's Watch Faces Are Getting Smaller
summary: Honey, I shrunk the watch face: inside the trend of the more compact men's watch face, now downsizing at brands like Panerai and Breitling.. summary: Online food-delivery startup prices offering at the bottom of its range, amid concern over profit outlook. title: Canada Looks to Immigration to Boost Economic Recovery
summary: Government's plan is most aggressive among large advanced economies, but targets could be hard to meet. Canada is betting on a sharp increase in immigration beginning this year as a way to boost the country's economic recovery from the Covid-19 pandemic.

summary: Housing built specifically for students is only 20% to 30% of total enrollment in the U.K.. After more than a year of attending classes online, most college students in the U.K. are planning to return to campuses in the fall.

summary: The company on Monday agreed to buy Swedish technology firm Itiviti. Broadridge Financial Solutions Inc.'s finance chief is working to reduce the company's debt levels, which are set to rise following a deal to acquire Swedish technology firm Itiviti Holding AB.

summary: Authorities promise to clear the traffic jam in three to four days but experts think it might take longer. Ships were again moving slowly through the Suez Canal on Tuesday, hours after engineers freed the Ever Given and cleared the waterway for global traffic.

summary: Media giant had outrun even other overhyped streaming names. Sometimes the right things happen for surprising reasons.

title: China Rewrites Hong Kong Election Rules to Keep Opponents Out
summary: Beijing slashes number of democratically elected seats and gives national-security police a veto over candidates. HONG KONG-China's top lawmaking body rewrote electoral rules for Hong Kong to give Beijing decisive control over how the city chooses its leader and legislators, putting pro-establishment politicians firmly in charge of the former British colony.

title: Suez Canal: How the Ship Blocking the Canal Was Freed
summary: Resume Subscription. On March 23, at about 7:30 a.m., the Ever Given, a 1,300-foot container ship, veered to the right as it was traversing the Suez Canal, wedging its bow into the canal wall and triggering a major rescue effort.

title: U.S. Companies Resist Activist Investor's Climate Campaign
summary: Drive aims to make large public companies set near-term carbon-emission targets subject to annual shareholder vote. A billionaire British hedge-fund manager's campaign to make large public companies set near-term targets for carbon-emission cuts is encountering challenges from U.S. corporations and money managers.

title: Facebook's Instagram for Kids Will Be Money
summary: Its potential Instagram-like app for children could pay off handsomely. Investors should know better by now than to accept a big move by a social-media company as solely altruistic.

title: MLB and NBA Offer Players an Incentive to Get Vaccinated: Normalcy
summary: Leagues won't mandate shots but will lessen restrictions for teams on which most people get them. Sports leagues playing through the pandemic are settling on a strategy for vaccinating their employees: They won't mandate shots, but they will promise a much better life for teams on which most people get them.

title: China Used Twitter, Facebook More Than Ever Last Year for Xinjiang Propaganda
summary: Efforts to reshape online narratives around Uyghur Muslims come as Beijing faces pressure over policies, including calls to boycott the 2022 Winter Olympics. HONG KONG-The Chinese government's activity on Twitter and Facebook over its policies toward ethnic minorities in Xinjiang reached an all-time high last year, as Beijing sought to portray its approach, including use of widespread internment camps and surveillance, as beneficial to the remote northwestern region.

title: As Covid-19 Vaccinations Ramp Up, Hesitancy Wanes
summary: Survey shows decline in reluctance, driven by increasing willingness in Southern states and more broadly among Black Americans. A shrinking percentage of Americans are expressing reluctance to get a Covid-19 vaccine, a positive sign for the efforts to get shots in the arms of enough people to reach herd immunity.

title: Older Millennials Are Closing the Wealth Gap With Their Parents
summary: Some millennials in their 30s are starting to own homes and save more. Americans in their 30s are starting to bridge the wealth gap with prior generations, though Black millennials still lag far behind, according to new research from the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis.

title: The Vietnamese Recovery Is Made in America
summary: Blighted last year by the halt to international travel, Vietnam's economy is returning to solid export-fueled growth that will likely continue thanks to U.S. fiscal stimulus. Vietnam's economy is growing again, on the back of a strong rise in exports. The Southeast Asian nation looks to be one of the most clear-cut international beneficiaries of the U.S. stimulus package.

title: How a Supermoon Helped Free the Suez Canal Ship
summary: Stronger tidal effect made it easier to partially float the Ever Given but also gave engineers a hard deadline. SUEZ, Egypt-To get the giant container ship blocking the Suez Canal unstuck, engineers needed the stars to align. Actually, the sun, Earth and moon.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: While You Were Sleeping, the Pac-12 Prepared to Dominate March Madness
summary: The once-mighty conference was largely ignored this year. Now three of its teams-Oregon State, UCLA and USC-have reached the Elite Eight. Through three rounds of the men's NCAA tournament, one conference has outperformed all the rest. It isn't the blue blood Atlantic Coast or Big East Conferences. Nor is it the Big Ten, which got an unprecedented nine teams into the tournament only to see eight of them knocked out before the Sweet 16.

title: School Choice Advances in the States
summary: The union shutdowns have increased support across the country for more educational options.. The pandemic has been a revelation for many Americans about union control of public schools that refuse to reopen. That awakening is helping to spur some welcome reform progress as several state legislatures are moving to expand school choice.

title: Who Is Archegos Fund Manager Bill Hwang?
summary: Billionaire founder of Tiger Asia was protégé of hedge-fund titan Julian Robertson, paid to settle insider-trading case in 2012. Losses at Archegos Capital Management have triggered the liquidation of positions approaching $30 billion in value, The Wall Street Journal has reported, and sent the shares of two major investment banks tumbling. Archegos is run by former Tiger Asia manager Bill Hwang. What do we know about Mr. Hwang?

title: New Yorkers Age 30 and Up Can Get Covid-19 Vaccines Starting Tuesday
summary: Residents 16 and older will be eligible starting on April 6, Gov. Andrew Cuomo says. New York state will make Covid-19 shots available to residents 30 years old and up starting on Tuesday, while New Jersey on Monday opened vaccine eligibility to include more public-facing workers.

title: Suez Canal Blockage Pressures Global Container Supply
summary: The giant boxes used to carry goods of all types are scarce-a problem likely to worsen even though the ship has been dislodged. HONG KONG-The blockage of the Suez Canal exposed another weak link in already-strained global supply chains: a shortage of shipping containers needed to move goods around the world.

title: Private-Equity Firms and ST Engineering in Bidding War for Cubic
summary: After Veritas and Elliott pairing raised its offer to $72 a share, ST Engineering responded by boosting its to $78. A bidding war has erupted around defense- and transit-technology company Cubic Corp. , which had agreed to sell itself to a pair of private-equity firms before a new corporate suitor surfaced last week.

title: Cherry-Blossom Season Returns After Pandemic Hiatus
summary: Brooklyn Botanic Garden anticipates surge in demand amid capacity restrictions. Getting to see the cherry blossoms at the Brooklyn Botanic Garden might be the hottest ticket in town this spring.

title: Brazil's President Reshuffles Cabinet as Anger Grows Over Covid-19 Death Toll
summary: Jair Bolsonaro has battled calls for his impeachment as deaths from the disease have surged above 300,000. SÃO PAULO-Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro unveiled a deep cabinet reshuffle Monday as his administration comes under intense pressure with Covid-19 raging out of control in the country, killing more than a hundred Brazilians an hour.

title: Activision Blizzard Names New CFO as Poaching Suit Against Netflix Continues
summary: The company promoted Armin Zerza to the role of finance chief; current CFO Dennis Durkin plans to retire. Activision Blizzard Inc. named a new finance chief, a move that comes as the company's lawsuit against Netflix Inc. for allegedly poaching its former chief financial officer continues.
